vulnerable_code: public abstract class BareboneTrustManagerExt implements javax.net.ssl.X509TrustManager
description: Custom TrustManager implementation can be dangerous as it can bypass the default trust mechanisms and allow connections to untrusted certificates. This can lead to man-in-the-middle attacks or data breaches.
recommendation: It is recommended to use the default trust mechanisms provided by the Java platform or to use a third-party library that has been audited for security.

description: The TrustManager is accepting null input for the certificate chain and the authentication type. This can allow an attacker to bypass the certificate validation process and establish a man-in-the-middle attack.
recommendation: The TrustManager should validate that the certificate chain and the authentication type are not null before proceeding with the validation process.

description: The getAcceptedIssuers method is returning null, which means that the TrustManager will accept any certificate. This can lead to man-in-the-middle attacks or data breaches.
recommendation: The getAcceptedIssuers method should return a non-null array of trusted issuers.
